Articles.Content:
Hey, everyone!

Another week rolls on and the challenges continue. While I didn't see too many challenge entries for the last one, the ones that were submitted were high quality. Thank you for them. We're going to to way better this week, though. Paraphrasing Crocodile Dundee, that wasn't a theme, this is a theme...

Australia

Incorporate the theme into a KSP-inspired fan work of your choosing and post it here in this thread. It could be a poem, a screenshot, a drawing, a song - anything you'd like that matches the theme and overall spirit of the challenge.

Our favorite fan works will be recognized through KSP's official social media channels.

Edited March 18, 2014 by Rowsdower
Challenge Updated
Gota get into this
*Rubs hands together*
Do we just post it in a thread or here?

Here is my shot

Duna is red

kerbin is blue,

i would fly all the way to Eleoo,

just to crash my heart for you.

Love you Jeb!!!

YESSSSS... another excuse to launch something insane into orbit.

EDIT: Would a Valentines-themed episode of the Kerb Kerman show count?

Edited February 11, 2014 by Xacktar

I'm in, where to post my entry? Here?

Edit: My entry....Wishing all Happy Valentines Day!

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Edited February 11, 2014 by Sirine

I'm in, where to post my entry? Here?

Sorry. I should have clarified that in the post. Here's the place

It's not a new thing, but here is my small contribution to the challenge :

Source is from this project (on stall for cause of third daughter being born )

Well,Not something amazing but,I sent Love satellite into orbit. Didnt stay there much but,Here it is.

Actually,We kerbals know no such thing as valentine day.

Well. 14 Flags mission for today is a Munar flyby, and try as I might, I don't think I can make a free return trajectory look like a heart. Guess I'll have to get interesting with that Duna base I'm about to launch.

Bob and Desley: sitting in a tree, K-I-S-S-I-N-G.

P.S.: Notice that it is Vall-entine's day. Also Being a Vallentine is as big a thing as getting married, hence Desley's reaction.
the kraken was going to attack and the last thing i thought about was your beauty

I was going to post a poem here involving love and planets and solid rocket boosters but I decided not to as people will probably want it removed from the face of the internet. Not because it was going to be a bad poem. Oh no.
Oooh. And I was planning a Valentine's Day-themed KSP Planet Comic this afternoon. Better get started on it.

I'm in, where to post my entry? Here?

Edit: My entry....Wishing all Happy Valentines Day!

http://imgur.com/a/4aDX5

Shouldn't that be Happy Delta-V Day?

Nice work!

Well. 14 Flags mission for today is a Munar flyby, and try as I might, I don't think I can make a free return trajectory look like a heart. Guess I'll have to get interesting with that Duna base I'm about to launch.

You might be able to set it up with maneuver node projected lines, like have a straightish shot to an outside Mun intercept, Node to bend it in, small orbit, node to bend back out on opposing side, then one last node to make a straighter shot back to Kerbin.

Lemme tinker with this and I'll PM ya a pic if I got it right.

Edited February 13, 2014 by Xacktar
I am sending a link to my blog, for a poem I wrote: http://variedmind.weebly.com/1/post/2014/02/ksp-love-poem.html
If you love someone let them go, if they come back... well, they were probably on a free return trajectory!

I am sending a link to my blog, for a poem I wrote: http://variedmind.weebly.com/1/post/2014/02/ksp-love-poem.html

You stole my Vall-entine's day!

I am too busy to partake in this for real this week, but I will submit my idea for someone else to potentially realize.

Launch two rockets with satelites shaped like kerbals. For lack of a proper idea of what a female kerbal looks like, just make the female one have long "hair" or something. Put a docking port on each one, on their hand (have each one with a hand outstretched). Once they are both in similar orbits, have them reach each other and dock hands. Turn SAS off and have the paired craft rotate slowly as they dance upon an imaginary dance floor set against the Kerbin and stars.

Since these are, of course, kerbals, each of the two should have a solid rocket booster strapped on their back, which they can then ignite simultaneously while they dance (if they dock using the same hand, the two boosters will even be symmetrical thrust-wise!).

You stole my Vall-entine's day!

I apologize, I did not see it. Want me to give you credit?
Good stuff so far, everyone. I can't to send some of it off to our other social media areas. Even bad poems are good in my eyes

So....

I was just about finished with my entry...when the save file corrupted.

Now I'm back to square one.

*various curse words*

I apologize, I did not see it. Want me to give you credit?

Funny how sarcasms and jokes are not transmitted through text, huh? I was just kidding.
